comments:
Build id: I20051101-0010

1. Switch to Java perspective
2. Create a type with a main method
3. Launch the type (run)
4. Rename the type
5. Switch to Debug perspective

Result:

org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugException: Launch configuration Foo at
c:\java\workspace\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.debug.core\.launches\Foo.launch
does not exist.

The launch is holding onto a launch configuration that has been renamed. The 
exception is logged because the configuration no longer exists.

I think the implementation of Launch should have an ILaunchConfigurationListener... (private inner class to avoid API changes at this point in the release). When the LC that the launch is associated with is deleted, it should be nulled out from the launch, unless it has been moved (see ILaunchManager.getMovedTo(...)), in which case, the pointer should be updated to the new launch configuration.
with the fix to bug 133563 I can no longer reproduce this bug, marking as FIXED, as the two bugs both had the same issues with main type refactoring in launch configurations.

traces.message: Launch configuration Foo at c:\java\workspace\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.debug.core\.launches\Foo.launch does not exist.
